Package com.cafean.client.anim

Class PushUpdateThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • com.cafean.client.anim.PushUpdateThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class PushUpdateThread
extends java.lang.Thread
    An encapsulated Timer class that includes different play modes and a delay. This thread is used to update the display of DataSource data in an animated display.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

    • Method Detail

      • setDelay

        public void setDelay​(int delay)
        Sets the desired sleep time between updates.
        Parameters:
        delay - the delay time in ms.

      • setPlayMode

        public void setPlayMode​(int mode)
        Sets the playback mode used by this thread as defined by PLAY_ALL or PLAY_LATEST.

      • getLock

        public java.lang.Object getLock()
        Retrieves the Object used by this thread to Object.wait() between updates.

      • startThread

        public void startThread()
        Restarts this update thread. Note that the thread actually runs for the lifetime of the object and simply Object.wait()s until startThread is called.

      • stopThread

        public void stopThread()
        Stops this update thread. Note that the thread actually runs for the lifetime of the object and simply Object.wait()s until startThread is called.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns true if this thread is currently running. Note that this is not the same as Thread.isAlive() as this thread is active for it's entire lifetime.

      • run

        public void run()
        Continuously processes the current JobChangeQueue, updating the SourceManager as appropriate based on the events received. All updates are sent on the Swing Event thread via SwingUtilities.invokeAndWait(java.lang.Runnable).
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
